job_title: Anonymous Employee in Boiling Springs, Cleveland, NC
pros: Some employees, despite the overwhelming oppressive and depressing environment and work conditions, still remain kind and caring people.
cons: When I got there, someone joked about how I should go to the same church as the university president.  I asked why, and my reply was the rhetorical question, "How far do you want to go here?"  So, how does one get ahead at GWU?  Be related to someone in administration or at least go to their church.  Positions have been created out of thin air for people who fit this description.  It felt like they were constantly announcing a new Associate Vice President for Blah, blah, blah, while other lower level faculty and staff were being pushed into buy-outs and early retirement.  Upper administration has run the university into the ground.  In addition to cutting staff, the university insurance, which wasn't great to begin with, has gone from a 80/20 copay to a 70/30.  The president used to like to insult our intelligence by starting his talks by reading headlines about bad things happening at other universities to "soften the blow" when he got around to announcing pay freezes, benefit cuts, etc.  The university is also schizophrenic in its vision-- pandering to evangelical parents on the one hand while many far left professors do everything they can to weaken or tear down the faith of the students on the other.  Unless you're related to someone here, or you're willing to cynically choose your place of worship to further your career path, I definitely do not recommend GWU.
